column2: Whole grain bread, Smoked Salmon, Avocado, Salt, Pepper, Red pepper flakes, Cherry tomatoes, Olive oil
column4: 2. Mash avocado and spread it evenly on the toast.
column5: 3. Use 2 forks to shred the smoked salmon and add it to the top of the avocado.
column6: 4. Sprinkle with salt pepper and red pepper flakes to taste.
column7: 5. Optionally top with sliced cherry tomatoes and a drizzle of olive oil.

column2: Greek yogurt, Granola (nut-free), Mixed berries (such as strawberries, blueberries, raspberries), Honey
column3: 1. In a bowl or glass layer Greek yogurt and granola.
column4: 2. Add a layer of mixed berries.
column5: 3. Repeat layers until the container is filled.

column2: Oats, Almond milk (nut-free), Berries (such as strawberries, blueberries, raspberries), Chia seeds, Maple syrup
column3: 1. Cook oats according to package instructions using almond milk.
column4: 2. Once cooked top with mixed berries and chia seeds.
column5: 3. Drizzle with maple syrup if desired.

column2: Frozen mixed berries, Banana, Spinach, Greek yogurt, Almond milk (nut-free), Chia seeds, Honey
column3: 1. In a blender combine frozen mixed berries banana spinach Greek yogurt almond milk and chia seeds.
column5: 3. Pour into a bowl and top with a drizzle of honey.

column2: Eggs, Bell peppers, Onion, Spinach, Tomato, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper
column3: 1. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
column4: 2. Saute diced bell peppers onions and spinach until tender.
column5: 3. Add beaten eggs to the skillet and cook until set.
column6: 4. Add diced tomatoes and season with salt and pepper.
column7: 5. Fold the omelette and serve hot.

column2: Quinoa, Mixed vegetables (such as cucumber, bell peppers, cherry tomatoes, red onion), Chickpeas, Lemon juice, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper, Fresh herbs (such as parsley, cilantro)
column3: 1. Cook quinoa according to package instructions and let it cool.
column4: 2. In a large bowl combine cooked quinoa mixed vegetables and chickpeas.
column5: 3. Drizzle with lemon juice and olive oil and season with salt pepper and fresh herbs.
column6: 4. Toss to combine and serve chilled.

column2: Chicken breast, Mixed greens (such as lettuce, spinach, arugula), Cherry tomatoes, Cucumber, Avocado, Red onion, Balsamic vinaigrette
column3: 1. Season chicken breast with salt and pepper and grill until cooked through.
column4: 2. Slice grilled chicken and set aside.
column5: 3. In a large bowl combine mixed greens cherry tomatoes sliced cucumber diced avocado and thinly sliced red onion.
column7: 5. Drizzle with balsamic vinaigrette and toss to combine.

column2: Mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, broccoli, carrots, snap peas), Tofu, Soy sauce, Garlic, Ginger, Olive oil, Sesame seeds, Green onions
column3: 1. Heat olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
column4: 2. Add minced garlic and ginger and cook until fragrant.
column5: 3. Add sliced tofu and cook until lightly browned.
column6: 4. Add mixed vegetables and stir-fry until tender-crisp.
column7: 5. Stir in soy sauce and cook for another minute.
column8: 6. Garnish with sesame seeds and chopped green onions before serving.

column2: Salmon fillets, Mixed vegetables (such as zucchini, bell peppers, cherry tomatoes, asparagus), Olive oil, Lemon juice, Garlic, Salt, Pepper, Fresh herbs (such as dill, thyme)
column4: 2. Toss mixed vegetables with olive oil lemon juice minced garlic salt pepper and fresh herbs.
column5: 3. Arrange seasoned vegetables on a baking sheet and roast in the oven for 20-25 minutes or until tender.
column6: 4. Season salmon fillets with salt and pepper and place on the baking sheet with the vegetables.
column7: 5. Return the baking sheet to the oven and roast for an additional 10-12 minutes or until the salmon is cooked through.

column2: Bell peppers, Quinoa, Black beans, Corn, Onion, Garlic, Tomato sauce, Chili powder, Cumin, Paprika, Salt, Pepper, Vegan cheese (optional)
column4: 2. Cook quinoa according to package instructions.
column5: 3. In a skillet saute diced onion and minced garlic until softened.
column6: 4. Add cooked quinoa black beans corn tomato sauce chili powder cumin paprika salt and pepper to the skillet. Cook for a few minutes until heated through.
column7: 5. Cut the tops off the bell peppers and remove the seeds.
column8: 6. Stuff each bell pepper with the quinoa mixture.
column9: 7. Place stuffed bell peppers in a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes.
column10: 8. Optionally top with vegan cheese during the last 5 minutes of baking.

column2: Spaghetti squash, Olive oil, Garlic, Marinara sauce (store-bought or homemade), Fresh basil, Salt, Pepper, Vegan parmesan cheese (optional)
column4: 2. Cut spaghetti squash in half lengthwise and scoop out the seeds.
column5: 3. Drizzle with olive oil and season with minced garlic salt and pepper.
column6: 4. Place squash halves cut-side down on a baking sheet and roast in the oven for 40-45 minutes or until tender.
column7: 5. Use a fork to scrape the flesh of the squash into spaghetti-like strands.
column8: 6. Heat marinara sauce in a saucepan over medium heat.
column9: 7. Serve spaghetti squash topped with marinara sauce fresh basil and vegan parmesan cheese if desired.

column2: Bell peppers, Zucchini, Red onion, Cherry tomatoes, Tofu, Olive oil, Balsamic vinegar, Garlic, Salt, Pepper, Fresh herbs (such as rosemary, thyme)
column4: 2. Cut bell peppers zucchini and red onion into bite-sized pieces.
column5: 3. Thread vegetables and cubed tofu onto skewers.
column6: 4. In a small bowl whisk together olive oil balsamic vinegar minced garlic salt pepper and fresh herbs.
column8: 6. Grill skewers for 8-10 minutes turning occasionally until vegetables are tender and slightly charred.

column2: Quinoa, Mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, broccoli, carrots, snap peas), Edamame, Garlic, Ginger, Soy sauce, Sesame oil, Green onions, Sesame seeds
column3: 1. Cook quinoa according to package instructions and set aside.
column4: 2. Heat sesame oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
column5: 3. Add minced garlic and ginger and cook until fragrant.
column6: 4. Add mixed vegetables and edamame to the skillet and stir-fry until tender-crisp.
column7: 5. Stir in cooked quinoa and soy sauce and cook for another 2-3 minutes.
column8: 6. Garnish with sliced green onions and sesame seeds before serving.

column2: Lentils, Mixed vegetables (such as carrots, celery, onion, bell peppers), Vegetable broth, Crushed tomatoes, Garlic, Bay leaves, Thyme, Salt, Pepper
column3: 1. Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
column4: 2. Add diced onion carrots celery and bell peppers to the pot and cook until softened.
column5: 3. Stir in minced garlic and cook for another minute.
column6: 4. Add lentils vegetable broth crushed tomatoes bay leaves thyme salt and pepper to the pot.
column7: 5. Bring the soup to a boil then reduce heat and simmer for 20-25 minutes or until lentils are tender.. 6. Serve hot.

column1: Baked Salmon with Quinoa and Asparagus
column2: Salmon fillets, Quinoa, Asparagus, Lemon, Olive oil, Garlic, Salt, Pepper, Fresh dill
column4: 2. Season salmon fillets with salt pepper minced garlic and fresh dill.
column5: 3. Place salmon fillets on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
column6: 4. Toss asparagus spears with olive oil lemon juice salt and pepper.
column7: 5. Arrange asparagus around the salmon on the baking sheet.
column8: 6. Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes or until salmon is cooked through and asparagus is tender.
column9: 7. Serve salmon and asparagus over cooked quinoa.
